name: Omegasaurus
description: New spin on an old deck. Added Omega to help with dealing with inner ice. Would love some feedback, thanks!

name: Nice or Naughty 1.3
description:
A major revamp:

  • 3 Daily Casts

  • 2 Armitage Codebusting

  • 2 Capstone

  • 1 Femme

  • 1 The Source

  • 1 Imp

  • 3 Magnum Opus

  • 2 Test Run

  • 2 Scavenge

  • 1 Crypsis

  • 1 Deus X

I feel as though this deck needs more long-term sustenance, and neither Armitage nor Daily Casts could solve that, so I snuck in 3x Opus. Scavenge and Test Run help you fetch an Opus in case of a bad hand, and help out with Imp recursion too.

Crypsis replaces Femme because Crypsis can get past more rezzed ICE, in case of ABT or any rezzer effects. Deus X is here because Jinteki. It hurts the Teki player in me to do so, though.

name: Conniving lil Brat - Blackmail Deck
description:
Blackmail deck. Originally had a different name for it but cleaned it up a little when I made it public.

So there are many things going on here and obviously room for influence. However at 41 cards that is already more than I would like and I'd rather have cards that fit the strategy than get out of faction cards just to use up influence. It was at 40 but added one of the source to help deal with Fast Advance which this deck doesn't fair well against.

It is absolutely a must to play with Shaper because of the 3 Quality Times and 3 Levy AR Lab Access which lets you reset and draw for the pieces you need. You can see I have planned for all the most common Ice that people will use Oversight AI or Bioroid Efficiency Research on. Also have 1 Crypsis to deal with Accelerated Beta Test popping some rezzed ice. If you are confused on why certain cards are in there feel free to leave a comment and I will explain.

name: Such an Ugly Word
description: Chaos Theory all-Blackmail deck

name: Exiled Faerie 3.1
description:
Faerie recursion, To use as super economic running, so pressure can be applied unexpectedly and when its needed.

The plan is to get in to anything, but only a few times. Hence Makers Eye rather than RDI and a few others...

Yes, not having plascrete has killed me, but I dont want to drop something to theme just to counter something that might come up

Decided on exile rather than kate because there are so few cards to get discounts on, and so much recursion.

A comment suggested I add in Shefluglebuster as it can turn the not discounts from kate into a bit of cash from all the 0 cost programs and recursion. Like the idea, went with it and decided to change the rest of the econ around a little as well.

Since I have noticed this deck needs big hunks of money now and then more than trickles of money to keep running every turn. Hopefully this will let me use big money with Femme to break later Sentries when I have run out of Faeries to recur.

name: Noise Score Denial.
NBN tagger

name: Rude Noise
description:
Might use too much influence from having two Personal Workshops, but I want there to be a good chance of drawing Professional Contact and Personal Workshop earlier in the game. Could probably use Kati Jones for economy but I don't own that expansion yet at home.

May need to rework this deck to include some Crash Space or Decoys to avoid getting tagged if possible.

Version 2. Changes are made to tackle those Oversight AI and BER.
Feedback and thoughts are welcome.

name: Chaos deck
description: The plan is to draw lots, install stuff from the heap, and kill ice with parasites using clone chips and datasuckers. Only one core set though - so only two Magnum Opus.

Andy: Twenty Sided Store Championship 2014

Professor
Cerebral Imaging ID Abuse
description: Cerebral Imaging ID Abuse

name: (De)construction v1
description:
Started out as "Weyland 7 Agenda", and grew to 8 in order to make the deck a little more flexible via Project Atlas.

Probably still could use a couple specific tweaks at this point. - Grim is nice. Wondering if it is worth the influence to splash Roto in its place, or take a second Grim, maybe Swordsman back (not much AI in my meta). - Overload vs Shutdown. Both gives it a bit more flexibility, but I do wonder if I can trim one to focus a bit more on the other and fit another Jackson/Melange/DRT. - The one SEA hasn't really hurt the ability to pop the runner. The deck digs deep, and Project Atlas is always there to help. I'd probably have to swap the Tollbooths for something else to take a second SEA again.

name: Kate Big Rig
description: I'm hoping that Mac's ability and Modded will be enough to be able to quickly install some of the big ice breakers, the Demo run is just something that should complement the HQ/R and D interfaces, mostly to trash key combo cards.

name: Lost Lover Digital Symphony Exile
description: LLDS Exile, featuring Prepaid VoicePADS, Replicators, and Dinosaurus.

name: Ser Gabriel vHJ1.5
description: With some solo testing I decided 2 crescent were more important than 2 inside job. I only have 2 desperado, I'll switch out another or go 46 cards when I can get another desperado. The silliness of faerie breaking archers and other entries easily combined with crescent will help keep the Corp poor. Even tollbooth only hurts for 5c with Knight, then it gets shut down with crescentus I went with two clone chips instead of levy and quality time for recursion. e3 feedback to make Knight and Peacock more effective.
